page.title: 08THE QUEEN'S VISIT.
page.content: On Friday 24th May{the Queen}came to Kendal to open the new{Territorial {Army Centre.}She arrived at{Oxenholme {Station}which had been specially cleaned, decorated with flowers and red carpetted for the occasion. The children from{St. Mark's School,}who had waited for over an hour in the rain, cheered and waved their flags to welcome Her Majesty, who was dressed in a coat of Kendal green. She went on to the T.A. Centre where it was raining heavily.{Fifty soldiers}were on parade including the dad of a proud {Mark Slater.}The Queen inspected the ranks, then pulled a string to reveal a plaque. This was the signal for everyone to clap and cheer. She waved, went to her car and drove off amidst the cheering and waving flags. The ranks of soldiers then marched off parade.
